step1.sentence: After years of working together, I've learned to place trust in my colleague's judgment even when the stakes are high.

step2.story: When the startup was on the verge of collapse, the board decided to place trust in a young CEO who had no corporate experience. She restructured the company within six months and doubled their revenue. Sometimes the boldest decisions come from trusting the right person.

step3.story: Daniel had been burned before. His last business partner had vanished with half the investment, leaving him drowning in debt. So when Maya proposed a joint venture, every instinct told him to walk away. But something about her transparency — the way she laid out every risk alongside every opportunity — made him reconsider. He chose to place trust in her, signing the contract with shaking hands. A year later, standing in their thriving office, he realized that sometimes the hardest leap of faith leads to the safest landing.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 신뢰를 (어딘가에) 놓다, 즉 누군가 또는 무언가를 믿고 의지한다는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 단순히 '믿다(trust)'보다 격식 있고 의도적인 느낌으로, 신중하게 판단한 뒤 누군가에게 믿음을 부여한다는 뉘앙스로 사용됩니다. 비즈니스, 리더십, 관계 맥락에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'place'는 '놓다/배치하다'라는 뜻이고, 'trust'는 고대 노르드어 'traust(신뢰, 확신)'에서 유래했습니다. 신뢰를 물건처럼 의식적으로 어딘가에 두는 은유적 표현입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 일상적인 'trust someone'보다 무게감이 있으며, 깊이 고민한 끝에 내리는 신뢰의 결정을 강조합니다. 공식적인 글이나 진지한 대화에서 주로 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The investors decided to place trust in the new management team.
